item.title: 特朗普引发加密货币投机热潮，狗狗币超越比特币
item.description: 最近几天，由于人们对当选总统唐纳德-特朗普领导下的加密货币行业前景的热情高涨，投机性押注浪潮一浪高过一浪，许多小型加密货币的表现超过了市场领头羊比特币。【原文：A bevy of smaller cryptocurrencies outperformed market-leader Bitcoin in recent days as enthusiasm about the sector’s prospects under President-elect Donald Trump encouraged a wave of speculative bets.】

item.title: 特朗普将埋葬 ESG，但它早已死亡
item.description:
绿色投资革命在美国从未有过机会 一度 陷入文化战争 ，但这并不是唯一的死因

。【原文：

The green investing revolution never stood a chance in the US once ensnared by the culture wars, but that wasn’t the only cause of death

item.title: 瑞士央行行长马丁认为中东战争和美国投票不会给法郎带来压力
item.description: 瑞士国家银行副行长安托万-马丁（Antoine Martin）认为，中东冲突和美国大选不会对瑞士法郎造成更大压力。【原文：The Swiss National Bank doesn’t see increased pressure on the franc from the conflict in the Middle East and the US elections, according to Vice President Antoine Martin.】

item.title: 美国影响力投资者斥资 15 亿美元瞄准农业科技初创企业
item.description: 美国一家非营利组织的目标是在 2030 年前筹集 15 亿美元，投资于专注于发展中国家农业适应性的初创企业。【原文：A US nonprofit is aiming to mobilize $1.5 billion to invest in startups that focus on agricultural adaptation across the developing world by 2030.】

item.title: 新西兰总理期待继续与美国开展太平洋合作
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克松（Christopher Luxon）表示，新西兰与美国的关系源远流长，他希望这种关系在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任总统期间继续保持下去。【原文：New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said his nation’s relationship with the US is a longstanding one and he expects that it will continue under Donald Trump’s presidency.】

item.title: 越南中央银行表示愿意出售美元以平息盾币汇率
item.description: 越南国家银行行长阮氏洪（Nguyen Thi Hong）周一表示，越南央行重申愿意出售美元，以保持越南盾在当地货币市场的稳定，维护宏观经济的稳定。【原文：Vietnam’s central bank reiterated it’s willing to sell US dollars to keep the dong stable in the local money market and maintain macroeconomic stability, State Bank Governor Nguyen Thi Hong said on Monday.】

item.title: 对冲基金在美国投票前看跌日元的程度为 8 月以来最高
item.description: 在上周美国总统大选之前，对冲基金对日元的看跌程度达到了 8 月份以来的最高水平，这表明许多对冲基金看好唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）获胜。【原文：Hedge funds turned the most negative on the yen since August in the run up to the US presidential election last week, suggesting many were positioned for a Donald Trump victory.】

item.title: 中国创业板与淡水河谷计划投资 14.2 亿美元建设印尼镍厂
item.description: 中国电池金属生产商创业板股份有限公司（GEM Co.【原文：GEM Co., a Chinese battery-metal producer, and Vale SA’s Indonesian unit signed an agreement to build a $1.42 billion nickel plant in the Southeast Asian nation, highlighting the country’s drive to boost processing.】

item.title: 日本基金追捧德国债券而回避法国债务
item.description: 9 月份，日本投资者购买了 2018 年以来最大金额的德国主权债务，同时，由于对法国财政的担忧，日本投资者继续远离法国债券。【原文：Japanese investors bought the largest amount of German sovereign debt since 2018 in September, while continuing to shift away from French bonds amid concern over the nation’s finances.】

item.title: 日本央行暗示对加息持谨慎态度，12 月加息暗示不明确
item.description: 日本央行 10 月份政策会议的意见摘要显示，日本央行董事会成员讨论了谨慎上调基准利率的必要性，并没有明确暗示下个月会上调基准利率。【原文：Bank of Japan board members discussed the need for caution on raising its benchmark rate and offered no clear hint of a move next month, a summary of opinions from its October policy meeting showed.】

item.title: 新西兰通胀预期上升，接近 2% 的目标值
item.description: 新西兰未来两年的通胀预期略有上升，但仍接近央行目标区间的中点。【原文：New Zealand two-year ahead inflation expectations crept higher, but remained near the midpoint of the central bank’s target band.】

item.title: 铁矿石跌向 100 美元，中国的最新定价令人失望
item.description: 铁矿石跌向每吨 100 美元，原因是中国政府振兴经济的最新努力令投资者失望，而中国港口库存的增加则凸显了供应充足。【原文：Iron ore fell toward $100 a ton as Beijing’s latest efforts to revive the economy left investors disappointed, while an expansion in Chinese port stockpiles highlighted ample supplies.】

item.title: 蒙特利尔港锁住码头工人，加拿大供应链雪上加霜
item.description: 由于一个雇主团体将 1200 名工会成员拒之门外，蒙特利尔港的装卸活动将被迫停止。【原文：Longshoring activity at the Port of Montreal is set to grind to a halt as an employers’ group locks out 1,200 union members.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，印度准备削弱卢比，与人民币保持一致
item.description: 据熟悉决策者想法的人士称，在唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选引发对美国提高关税的担忧后，印度央行准备让卢比与人民币同步走软。【原文：India’s central bank is ready to let the rupee weaken in tandem with the Chinese yuan after Donald Trump’s election win spurred fears of higher US tariffs, according to people familiar with the thinking of policymakers.】

item.title: 中国股市面临财政刺激政策的压力
item.description: 备受瞩目的立法会议结果令投资者大失所望，他们原本希望通过大规模刺激措施来提振经济并结束通货紧缩周期，但中国股市却因此承压。【原文：Chinese stocks are under pressure after a high-profile legislative meeting turned out to be a letdown for investors who had hoped for large-scale stimulus to boost the economy and end a deflationary cycle.】

item.title: Swiggy 如何在印度击败亚马逊，实现 13 分钟杂货送达
item.description:
它拥有一支临时工大军、一队迷你仓库和大牌投资者。但这并不能保证它能在交易中一鸣惊人。【原文：

item.title: 前世贸组织总裁拉米称美国应将贸易逆差视为优势
item.description: 世界贸易组织前主席帕斯卡尔-拉米说，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普应将美国的贸易逆差视为一种优势，而不是因为美元的力量而成为一种弱点。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump should see America’s trade deficit as an advantage rather than a weakness because of the power of the US dollar, former World Trade Organization chief Pascal Lamy said.】

item.title: 瑞银在澳大利亚的顶级银行家认为自己的角色是帮助超级富豪海外投资
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）预计，随着资产的增长，澳大利亚富人将寻求更多的境外投资，他们希望实现更多的多元化。【原文：UBS Group AG expects rich Australians to seek more investment outside the country as assets grow and they want to diversify more.】

item.title: 中国经济拯救计划让大宗商品陷入停滞
item.description: 中国最近一次重振经济的努力侧重于亟需的地方政府债务重组，但却没有采取直接拉动内需的刺激措施，全球大宗商品市场因此陷入停滞状态。【原文：Global commodities markets are stuck in a holding pattern after China’s latest effort to revive its economy focused on the much-needed restructuring of local government debt, but stopped short of stimulus measures that would directly boost domestic demand.】

item.title: 菲律宾比索将随年底汇款潮反弹
item.description: 随着圣诞假期前海外汇款的季节性回升，菲律宾比索有望从 10 月份的下滑中恢复过来。【原文：The Philippine peso is poised to recover from a slide in October with a boost from a seasonal pick up in overseas remittances ahead of the Christmas holidays.】

item.title: 石油价格在暴跌后企稳，中国前景和需求成为关注焦点
item.description: 由于头号进口国中国的疲软前景继续困扰市场，石油价格在创下近两周来最大单日跌幅后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after the biggest one-day drop in almost two weeks as a soft outlook in top importer China continued to plague the market.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将下跌，比特币突破 80,000 美元：市场综述
item.description: 在中国的刺激措施不尽如人意以及周末的数据显示通货紧缩风险持续存在之后，亚洲股市可能在早盘交易中挣扎。在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普一举拿下美国七个选战州之后，比特币突破了 80,000 美元。【原文：Asian stocks may struggle in early trading after Chinese stimulus measures underwhelmed and data over the weekend showed persistent deflation risks. Bitcoin topped $80,000 after President-elect Donald Trump took a clean sweep of the seven US battleground states.】

item.title: MUFG 看好印度，寻求并购交易推动增长
item.description: 三菱日联金融集团（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. is bullish on India, where it’s actively looking for acquisition targets that will help boost its presence in the world’s most populous nation.】

item.title: 印度航空公司的调整促进了竞争和商务座位的增加
item.description: 印度的航空公司将迎来具有里程碑意义的一周，其中两个里程碑相隔几天，将重新定义世界上增长最快的航空市场之一的竞争格局。【原文：India’s airlines are set for a landmark week, with two milestones days apart, that will redefine the competitive landscape in one of the world’s fastest-growing aviation markets.】

item.title: 恒天然将评估首次公开募股（IPO）作为出售消费者部门的一种选择
item.description: 恒天然合作社集团（Fonterra Cooperative Group）将继续推进其全球消费者业务的出售进程，表示将考虑首次公开募股，并重申交易成功将为农民股东带来资本回报。【原文：Fonterra Cooperative Group will go ahead with the sale process for its global consumer businesses, saying it will consider an initial public offering and reiterating that a successful deal will result in a capital return for its farmer shareholders.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》称，特朗普建议普京反对乌克兰局势好转
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》周日报道，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普建议俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京不要使乌克兰战争升级，并提醒他美国在欧洲有相当规模的军事存在。【原文：US President-elect Donald Trump advised Russia’s Vladimir Putin not to escalate the war in Ukraine and reminded him of the sizable US military presence in Europe, the Washington Post reported Sunday.】

item.title: 威尔伯-罗斯表示，特朗普很可能对加拿大能源免征关税
item.description: 美国前商务部长威尔伯-罗斯（Wilbur Ross）表示，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将实施其对进口商品征收关税的计划，但很可能会对加拿大石油和天然气等行业给予豁免。【原文：President-Elect Donald Trump will follow through on his plans to hit imports with tariffs but is likely to carve out exemptions for sectors such as Canadian oil and gas, former US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said.】

item.title: 做空特斯拉的对冲基金损失超过 50 亿美元
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选以来，坚持押注特斯拉公司的对冲基金已经损失了数十亿美元，因为他们感受到了当选总统与埃隆-马斯克之间特殊关系的影响。【原文：Since Donald Trump’s election win, the hedge funds clinging on to bets against Tesla Inc. have lost billions of dollars, as they feel the fallout of the special relationship between the president-elect and Elon Musk.】
